ReviewText: The crust was thin, crispy, and cooked to perfection. Best margherita in town!
Way too much grease. The box was soaked through and the pizza was cold.
Great flavor profile, but the delivery took over an hour. Pizza was still tasty though.
Found a hair in my toppings. Absolutely disgusted. Never ordering again.
That spicy honey drizzle is a total game changer. 10/10 recommend.
The pizza is okay, but honestly, it’s overpriced for the size you get.
Authentic wood-fired taste. It reminds me of the pizza I had in Naples.
The dough was raw in the middle. I had to put it in my own oven to finish it.
Solid pepperoni pizza. The garlic knots are also a hidden gem.
The manager was incredibly rude when I called to complain about my burnt order.
Quick service and hot pizza. The 'Meat Lovers' is packed with toppings.
Average pizza. Nothing special, but it gets the job done for a Tuesday night.
I love the vegan cheese options here. Very inclusive menu!
Too salty. I had to drink a gallon of water after two slices.
The truffle oil aroma hits you as soon as you open the box. Pure heaven.
They forgot my drinks and the extra sauce I paid for. Frustrating.
Great crust-to-sauce ratio. Could use a bit more seasoning in the sauce.
Our go-to Friday night spot. Kids love the plain cheese, I love the pesto.
The toppings all slid off to one side during delivery. A total mess.
Good pizza, but the restaurant was way too loud and cramped.
Crispy edges and a soft center. Exactly how a New York slice should be.
I ordered a veggie pizza and they sent me one with sausage. I'm a vegetarian.
The Buffalo Chicken pizza has just the right amount of kick.
Friendly staff and the most amazing sourdough crust I've ever had.
The sauce tasted like it came straight out of a cheap tin can. Very metallic.
